javelin.view.screen

Class BattleScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • javelin.old.TPanel
            • javelin.old.Screen
              • javelin.view.screen.BattleScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WorldScreen

    public class BattleScreen
extends Screen
    Screen context during battle. TODO it has become a hierarchy that behaves how different types of Fights should behave. The ideal would be for all this type of controller behavior to move to Fight. For example: LairScreen . TODO the 2.0 interface should absolutely not be redrawn every time, only when an update is needed and even then the redraw should be on a tile-by-tile basis, not the entire screen. TODO many things this is actually handling should be moved to Fight controllers instead. TODO BattleScreen should not be the supertype for WorldScreen and such. Extract a proper super type or move everything to a proper context controller. Would probably be better to make this a unified ContextScreen and delegate all differences to the context objects.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • active

        public static BattleScreen active
        Active BattleScreen implementation.
        See Also:
        WorldScreen, DungeonScreen

      • partialmove

        public static float partialmove
        Keeps track of human Movement steps using the keyboard. We want to allow them to move up to a ActionCost.MOVE action without disruption their current action - even if RepeatTurn is thrown from another action (like cancelling a menu, etc.). BattleMouse and BattleWalker take this into consideration too, so as not to allow the player to cheat by using half their share of keyboard movements and then using another ActionCost.MOVE worth of movement witht the mouse. Mouse moves, however are instantaneous and apply the relevant AP cost, plus the current value of this variable. This of course still allows player to make shorter, tactical moves (consuming less AP) if so desired.

      • mainLoop

        public void mainLoop()
        this is the main game loop. it catches any exceptions for stability and lets the game continue
        very important that endTurn() gets called after the player moves, this ensures that the rest of the map stays up to date
